description:
As the world's data grows, so does its aptitude for AI.
-------------------------------------------------------

In the context of business, however, translating black-box-magic into
something more accessible for business-users to engage with is tricky.
While this speaks to a larger problem of upskilling and making education
more accessible, one method of translation is through story telling.

I learn best when an **idea is relatable, simple, and colourful**. This
talk is going to look at how to convey complex ideas simply. I'm going
to be covering two sections:

1. That's So Random (Forests)!
2. You Gotta (Neural) Network to Get Work

I'll run through the high level concepts and methodologies, and then
show the work/code that was done to create a random forest, and a neural
network. Note: this will cover how I built the RF, and NN using Python
via Jupyter Notebook.

This session is for anyone who uses/wants to use ML to solve problems
but struggles with translating the black-box-magic. It's going to be an
engaging, and slightly animated, talk with the intention of reinforcing
concepts and showcasing different ways of explaining them.
title: So What's the Story?
